title: Honeyland, 2019 - ★★★★½
review: I want the best for Hatidze.

title: Roald Dahl's Matilda the Musical, 2022 - ★★★★½
review: Didn’t think I’d like it as much as the 1996 film. Not only did it exceed my expectations, but it just might have surpassed the original. Time will tell.

title: Nomadland, 2020 - ★★★★½
review: See you down the road.

title: M3GAN, 2022 - ★★★½
review: *Insert poorly formed ChatGPT reference here*

title: Acrimony, 2018 - ½
review: This movie is a Dr Umar meme.

title: The Beasts, 2022 - ★★★★★
review: I guess I have to watch all of Sorogoyen’s work now. Impeccable.

title: The Ritual, 2017 - ★★★½
review: Well paced and kept the tension throughout. The ending was a bit naff, but I enjoyed my time with it.

title: Free Solo, 2018 - ★★★★
review: I couldn’t be friends with Alex Honnold, but I respect Alex Honnold.

title: John Wick: Chapter 4, 2023 - ★★★ (contains spoilers)
review:
This review may contain spoilers.

It was fun but definitely didn’t need to be almost 3 hours. Also, the generic club fight scene annoyed me, like, I get the movie’s self aware, but I need a little seasoning on these tropes.

title: Everest, 2015 - ★★★★
review: “He might as well be on the moon”

title: Money Shot: The Pornhub Story, 2023 - ★★
review: I understand the tension between protecting sex workers and holding companies like PornHub to account, but I do find the lack of focus on the actual consumers of porn a glaring omission. An incomplete exploration.

title: Good Bye Lenin!, 2003 - ★★★★
review: Touching. Truman Show adjace. Historical timestamp.

title: Creed III, 2023 - ★★★★
review: Jonathan Majors was possessed in this. The subtleties he brought to the character of Dame Anderson shows how skilled an actor he is.

title: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory, 1971 - ★★★★
review: “So much time and so little to do!”

title: TÁR, 2022 - ★★★½
review: Acting and dialogue were amazing, although there wasn’t the payoff for everything they set up. Might have been intentional, but I can’t help feeling there was more story to be told.

title: Knuckle, 2011 - ★★★★
review: Traveling communities caught in a generation loop of conflict. An unsettling watch, but eye-opening nonetheless.

title: The Strays, 2023 - ★★
review:
A really interesting concept that unfortunately just wasn't executed well. They knew how to get the plane off the runway, but had no plan on where to go or how to land.

Still, I wanna see more unique ideas on the big screen, so I'm happy this exists. Hopefully, Martello-White can build on this for his next film.

title: Chef, 2014 - ★★★★½
review: Sometimes you watch a movie at just the right time in your life.

title: Triangle of Sadness, 2022 - ★★★★½
review:
I stopped after watching half of the trailer and was instantly sold.

What a ride. I didn’t want it to end.

title: Midsommar, 2019 - ★★★
review:
So I went back to this after watching The Wicker Man. The first time I watched it I think I unfairly lamented that it wasn’t Hereditary. After a second watch, not much has changed for me.

Ari Aster does grief like no one else. Florence Pugh’s performance was great. It’s shot beautifully.

The story didn’t move me.

It’s a good movie but I think it’s less than the sum of it’s parts.

title: The Wicker Man, 1973 - ★★★★
review:
Really enjoyed this. Watching this has made me want to revisit Midsommar for how to do horror in the light.

From the perceived moral superiority of Sgt. Howie, to the realisation of being caught in the spider’s web, I thought the it was a well told story with a great score.

title: Hellraiser, 1987 - ★★
review:
Double u, tee, eff?

Great FX though.

title: Aisha, 2022 - ★★★½
review: Great chemistry between Wright and O’Connor. The film did a good job of continuing to highlight the enormous challenges facing refugees every day.

title: Speak No Evil, 2022 - ★★★★
review:
A deeply unsettling watch.

A great movie I won’t watch again.

An infuriating exploration of consent and boundaries.

I was challenged by this movie. I hated this movie.

title: The Menu, 2022 - ★★★★
review: Never a dull moment. Maybe served up more ideas than it was able to digest, but I left satisfied nonetheless.

title: Drive, 2011 - ★★★½
review: Great soundtrack. Longing stares. Ultraviolence.

title: Uncle Buck, 1989 - ★★★½
review: Wholesome holiday movie with a few played out clichés of the time.

title: Glass Onion, 2022 - ★★★
review: Enjoyable mystery movie.

title: Matilda, 1996 - ★★★★½
review: “Sometimes in life, horrible and unexplainable things happen. These things are a test of character. And I have character.”

title: The Haunting, 1963 - ★★★½
review: I wanted to spend more time with these characters. Loved the flow of the dialogue. Just wasn’t scary.

title: Black Panther: Wakanda Forever, 2022 - ★★★½
review: I enjoyed it.

title: Lake Mungo, 2008 - ★★½
review: Interesting concept but not enough meat on the bone.

title: Ringu, 1998 - ★★½
review: Insufferable protagonist. Who hugs a corpse ever so gently?

title: The Silence of the Lambs, 1991 - ★★★★
review: Great writing. Smartly depicts the danger of men.

title: Poltergeist, 1982 - ★★★½
review: Solid.

title: Jaws, 1975 - ★★★★★
review:
The last 30 minutes might be the best half hour I’ve seen in any movie.

Grounded storytelling with a sprinkle of fantasy adventure.

title: The Exorcist, 1973 - ★★★★
review: Uncomfortable.

title: The Witch, 2015 - ★★★★
review:
Man like Black Philip.

Simple, effective storytelling. Great dialogue and performances.
